posts.name: Roxxy S
posts.cooked: Hello Chief Delphi! Our team is considering purchasing new laptops for CAD work, as all our current devices have been taken by programming. We need laptops that can run Autodesk Fusion 360 smoothly and preferably under $1000 USD. Currently, the school-provided Chromebooks are not performing adequately.

posts.name: Titus Casas
posts.cooked: It has a dedicated GPU, good Wi-Fi card; it should work well. A touchscreen isn't necessary. Any dedicated, affordable "gaming" laptop should suffice since it features a GPU designed to render 3D scenes. If you're running simulations, you'll want a fast CPU too.

posts.name: Zakk Jackson
posts.cooked: The text is: My friend just picked up one of these and it is really nice and would work well for CAD. HP Victus

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: One of the advantages of Onshape is that many calculations are performed on the server side, allowing even Chromebooks to utilize it effectively.

posts.name: Zakk Jackson
posts.cooked: I will say, Chromebooks wonâ€™t run Onshape smoothly

posts.name: Titus Casas
posts.cooked: Many Chromebooks come with small screens, slow processors, and limited Wi-Fi connectivity, making them frustrating to use. Speaking from firsthand experience, the screen often truncates a lot of information, forcing users to switch to full screen mode to view everything in the mini tabs, which can confuse newcomers.

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: Yeah, I wouldn't recommend it, I just mean it's theoretically possible.

posts.name: Roxxy S
posts.cooked: All of our CAD training focuses on designing in Fusion, so transitioning to Onshape requires our current CAD team to learn the new software and recreate those lessons for Onshape. Additionally, since we perform all machining in-house, CAM capabilities are essential.

posts.name: Titus Casas
posts.cooked: Our team did that last year; we still use fusion for CAM. If you did that, I recommend taking the FRCDesign.org course, which covers everything needed for FRC and also installs the MKA CAD addon. It offers bearings, motors, and various FRC-related models. I personally prefer fusion, but when used with MKA and its wide viewing capabilities, it becomes much better for FRC than fusion alone.

posts.name: Roxxy S
posts.cooked: "I will definitely look into these"

posts.name: Isaac Proctor
posts.cooked: I think you could get MacBooks from two to three years ago for around $600. MacOS supports fusion, and they have pretty good performance and really good battery life.

posts.cooked: Yeah but MacOS

posts.name: Isaac Proctor
posts.cooked: Last year we faced challenges with our CAD processes, but this year our team adopted improved practices focusing on parametric design and faster regeneration times. Our CAD now performs exceptionally well on Chromebooks. Here are some tips: Avoid using the hole feature when unnecessary (as extrude remove is usually faster). Utilize linear and circular patterns along with mirroring (we realized these features exist and started using them this year). Lastly, avoid creating separate part studios for every single part (we reduced this to fewer than 100 part studios this year).

posts.name: Titus Casas
posts.cooked: Why buying multiple Macs is not advisable for CAD work: First, Macs do not have dedicated GPUs, which can limit rendering capabilities critical for CAD tasks. Second, running CAD software on macOS often leads to compatibility issues compared to Windows. Third, many Apple products require additional purchases for specific features, increasing costs. Fourth, Macs are generally more expensive than Windows counterparts and face slower updates. Fifth, Apple devices often undergo extensive software updates that can degrade performance. Sixth, avoiding Macs with dedicated GPUs due to their high power consumption is wise; instead, consider newer laptops with integrated graphics or even Windows for better performance.

posts.name: Ryan Reed
posts.cooked:
Proper indentation is essential when writing code to ensure readability. Each level of nesting should increase the indent by two spaces, helping maintain the code's structure and making debugging easier. Always declare variables before using them to prevent runtime errors. Declaring variables too late can lead to confusion and potential bugs down the line.

This statement applies to all programming languages. However, certain languages like JavaScript or Python do not require explicit variable declarations and instead automatically assign types based on usage. These languages might cause issues if variables are used before being defined due to their dynamic typing system.

In Java, for example, you cannot use a variable that hasn't been initialized yet. This strict type-checking ensures that there are no runtime errors at execution time. Debugging such issues can be more challenging compared to dynamically typed languages because every variable has a specific type associated with it.

posts.name: joel truher
posts.cooked: Reborn Electronics (StockMustGo) provides refurbished laptops, including models like the HP ZBook Studio G7 and Dell Precision 7560, priced between $300 and $500. These machines feature high-end specs such as i7 processors, NVIDIA Quadro GPUs, and 512GB SSDs, suitable for professional use. The HP ZBook includes an NVIDIA T1000, while the Dell model features a T1200. Both come with Windows 11 Pro, 32GB RAM, and include a headphone/microphone combo. Prices may vary based on condition, with the Dell listing being in 'Good' condition.
